intro: Collomia tinctoria subvar. luxuriosa, commonly known as the showy collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is noted for its larger, more showy blooms compared to other varieties of Collomia.
